entries.meaning: (computing) A character that takes the place of any other character or string that is not known or specified.
examples: A wildcard character is a symbol that you can use with many DCL commands to apply the command to several files at once, rather than specifying each file individually.

entries.meaning: (also written wild card) An uncontrolled or unpredictable element.
examples: There are several technical wildcards, such as how the larger battery packs--four times larger than those of the Prius--will withstand the rigors of city driving,  […]

entries.meaning: (also written wild card) An element, often deliberately concealed, which is withheld for contingency.
(sports, card games) Alternative form of wild card.
